titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that members of the Screen Actors Guild should contribute funds to a private, self-sustaining endowment for the arts.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Economic and Educational Opportunities. to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Early Childhood, Youth and Families.

committee.name: House Committee on Economic and Educational Opportunities

term.name: National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities

bill.summary: 5/18/1995--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that the Screen Actors Guild should request that those of its members with annual individual incomes over $1 million place ten percent of such income in an endowment for the arts, which is to be administered by a privatized National Endowment for the Arts when $1 billion has accumulated in such fund.
